sentence.Network_en: The men voted by a four-to-one majority to accept the pay offer.
sentence.Network_cn: 男雇员以4比1的多数票接受了工资条件。

jx.jx_en_mean: belong to or constitute the larger group or number

lj.lj_ly: publishing houses where women are in the majority.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting superiority): from French majorité, from medieval Latin majoritas, from Latin major (see major)

entry.def: The majority of people or things in a group is more than half of them.

example.ex: The majority of my patients come to me from out of town...
example.tran: 大多数来找我看病的患者都是外省人。

example.ex: The vast majority of our cheeses are made with pasteurised milk...
example.tran: 我们生产的绝大部分奶酪都是用巴氏消毒过的牛奶制成的。

entry.tran: 多数票;超过对方的票数
entry.def: A majority is the difference between the number of votes or seats in parliament or legislature that the winner gets in an election, and the number of votes or seats that the next person or party gets.

example.ex: Members of parliament approved the move by a majority of ninety-nine...
example.tran: 议员以99张的多数票批准了这项动议。

example.ex: According to most opinion polls, he is set to win a clear majority...
example.tran: 从大多数民意调查的结果来看，他很有可能以绝对多数票胜出。

entry.tran: (观点、决定、体制等)多数人支持的，多数人拥护的
entry.def: Majority is used to describe opinions, decisions, and systems of government that are supported by more than half the people involved.

example.ex: ...her continuing disagreement with the majority view...
example.tran: 她与大多数人的观点依旧不一致

example.ex: A majority vote of 75% is required from shareholders for the plan to go ahead.
example.tran: 这项计划若要实施，必须获得股东 75%的多数票。

entry.tran: 法定成年年龄(英国和美国大多数州规定为18周岁)
entry.def: Majority is the state of legally being an adult. In Britain and most states in the United States, people reach their majority at the age of eighteen.

example.ex: The age of majority in Romania is eighteen...
example.tran: 罗马尼亚的法定成年年龄为18周岁。

example.ex: Once you reach your majority, you may do what you damned well please.
example.tran: 等你成年后，就可以随心所欲了。

means.word_mean: 1. the property resulting from being or relating to the greater in number of two parts; the main part;

sentences.sentence: "the majority of his customers prefer it"
"the bulk of the work is finished"

means.word_mean: 2. (elections) more than half of the votes
3. the age at which a person is considered competent to manage their own affairs

Sentence.sentence: The high cost of steam and the lesser need for speed kept the majority of the world's ocean freight moving by sail until the early years of the 20th century.
The majority of them think it less important than computers.
The majority of them find it interesting
Some version of the Swedish system might work well for a majority of American parents,but the United States is unlikely to fully embrace the Swedish model.
And at the vast majority of places, it is simply not a big variable in the college's decision-making process.
In it the majority of students will have conformed to the standard model of the time: male, middle class and Western.

means.word_mean: 多数, 大多数; 半数以上

sentences.en: A majority vote enabled the passage of the resolution.
sentences.cn: 多数人投赞成票使议案得以通过。

sentences.en: The majority of his books are kept upstairs.
sentences.cn: 他的大部分书收藏在楼上。

sentences.en: The majority of the damage is easy to repair.
sentences.cn: 这次的大部分损害容易补救。

means.word_mean: 票数差距, 多得的票数, 超过的票数

sentences.en: The draft resolution was adopted by a majority of 128.
sentences.cn: 这项提案以超过128票的多数获得通过。

jushi.english: The majority of his books are kept upstairs.
jushi.chinese: 他的大部分书藏在楼上。

jushi.english: Dr. Gray was elected by a large majority.
jushi.chinese: 格雷博士以多数票当选。

jushi.english: The majority of the damage is easy to repair.
jushi.chinese: 这次的大部分损害容易补救。
